arm_group.description: Uterine artery ligation will be done for patients in this group

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial will address the effect of uterine artery ligation during Cesarean section in
      cases with placenta previa to decrease blood loss.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uterine Artery Ligation to Decrease Blood Loss With Central Placenta Previa

detailed_description.textblock:
This Study will address the effect of uterine artery ligation prior to fetal delivery during
      Cesarean section in cases with central placenta previa to guard against postpartum
      hemorrhage and to minimize blood loss.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Placenta previa is diagnosed when the lowest placental edge is located within 5 cm of
             the internal os at ultrasound

          -  Symptomatic Placenta previa with at least one episode of bleeding

          -  Estimated gestational age within 28 to 40 weeks

          -  Maternal age > 18 years

          -  Informed consent

          -  Social affiliation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Premature rupture of membranes

          -  Severe bleeding.

          -  Abnormal fetal heart rates.

          -  Pre-eclampsia, chorioamnionitis, severe chronic renal disease.

intervention.description: Uterine artery ligation during cesarean section before delivery of the baby

clinical_study.official_title: Uterine Artery Ligation to Minimize Blood Loss in Patients With Central Placenta Previa

primary_outcome.description: Changes in hemoglobin level before and after CS will reflect the amount of blood loss during operation
primary_outcome.time_frame: hemoglobin level will be done baseline and will be repeated 24 hours after delivery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During CS and within 3 hours after CS

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
